Explanations about Options.-D(C): So your aplay command would become "aplay -D front:CARD=CK804,DEV=0 somefile.wav", and you can use the same devicename in your .asoundrc.
Explanations about Options.-l(M): List all soundcards and digital audio devices

1   combined    module-combine-sink.c   s16le 2ch 44100Hz   IDLE
2   alsa_output.pci-0000_01_00.1.hdmi-stereo    module-alsa-card.c  s16le 2ch 44100Hz   RUNNING

Explanations about Options.--start(M):
Start PulseAudio if it is not running yet. This is different from starting
 PulseAudio without --start which would fail if PA is already running. PulseAudio is
 guaranteed to be fully initialized when this call returns. Implies --daemonize.
Explanations about Options.-k(M):
Kill an already running PulseAudio daemon of the calling user (Equivalent to
 sending a SIGTERM).

Answers.Most Similar TLDR Task: Start the pulseaudio daemon in the background
